intro: Baccharis emarginata, commonly known as the Brazilian baccharis, is a shrub or small tree native to South America. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often gray-green in color. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, typically blooming in late summer to early autumn. Baccharis emarginata is adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites. It plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for local wildlife.
